context: Tests whether the agent uses rule-oriented format for independent requirements, includes specific API response codes, covers form validation patterns, and handles error scenarios appropriately.

checklist.name: Rule-oriented format
checklist.description: Uses rule-oriented checklist format rather than Given/When/Then for independent API requirements

checklist.name: Specific response codes
checklist.description: Includes exact HTTP response codes (201, 400, 409, etc.) for different scenarios

checklist.name: Form validation rules
checklist.description: Specifies email format validation, password requirements, and field constraints

checklist.name: Error handling details
checklist.description: Defines specific error messages and validation feedback for different failure cases

checklist.name: Checkbox format usage
checklist.description: Uses checkbox format (- [ ]) for rule-oriented criteria to enable pass/fail validation

checklist.name: Negative scenarios
checklist.description: Includes failure cases like duplicate email, invalid format, missing fields

checklist.name: Measurable constraints
checklist.description: Specifies measurable limits (password length, email format regex, response timing)

checklist.name: Independent requirements
checklist.description: Each requirement can be validated independently without dependencies on other criteria

checklist.name: User outcome focus
checklist.description: Focuses on user-observable outcomes rather than internal implementation details

checklist.name: Stakeholder alignment
checklist.description: References need for validation with product owner, QA, and development team before implementation

checklist.name: Scope boundaries
checklist.description: Includes out-of-scope items to prevent feature creep and clarify boundaries
